alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 3:54PM PST until January 04 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Winter Weather Continues through Early Tuesday... .A weather system continues to bring snow to the mountains of interior NorCal through early Tuesday. The heaviest snow will occur over the mountains north of Redding into the evening and over Plumas County and the Lassen Park area above 4,000 feet tonight into Tuesday. Lighter snowfall accumulations will impact travel over the Northern Sierra Interstate 80 and Highway 50 tonight into Tuesday. Strong winds will also accompany this weather system and could cause limited visibility at times as well as downed tree branches and weakened trees. The strongest winds will be over Plumas County and eastern Shasta County above 4,000 feet where gusts up to 65+ mph will be possible, causing downed trees and power lines. If you`re planning travel over the mountains early this week, stay in touch with the latest forecasts. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Plan on slippery road conditions, including during the evening commute. Damage to trees and power lines is possible. Total wet snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, with localized amounts up to 15 inches, are expected. * WHERE...West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada. * WHEN...4 PM today to 7 AM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibilities at times. Snow level 4500 feet this evening rising to 5500 feet after midnight. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for wet snow means periods of wet snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
